00.title: ALGEMENE WERFORGANISATIE

00.00.title: Algemene werforganisatie
00.00.summary:
- The contractor must provide a site installation that enables them to perform the work to the satisfaction of the administration.
- The contractor must erect a temporary fence around the construction site, equipped with lockable entrances. The fence must be at least 1.80m high and made of prefabricated steel panels with galvanized wire mesh.
- The contractor must create a site layout plan indicating traffic organization, main and secondary entrances, location of construction facilities, storage areas, and equipment.
- The contractor is responsible for the signaling, lighting, and marking of the construction site during the entire duration of the works.
- A description of the existing condition must be made by an approved expert before the start of the work.
- The contractor must submit a work plan and as-built dossier.
- The contractor must take measures to protect adjacent areas from damage and dust.
- The contractor must provide necessary ladders and scaffolding that meet specific safety standards.
- The contractor must maintain order and cleanliness on the construction site.
- The contractor must provide machines and equipment with noise reduction measures.
- The contractor must take measures to limit dust.
- The contractor must protect the finished buildings and/or premises and keep them in good condition until the preliminary acceptance.
- Existing doors, windows, frames, and trim must be removed.
- Masonry must be demolished, including wall tiles, and the debris must be removed.
- Existing supply and discharge pipes must be removed.
- Existing floor coverings and screeds must be removed.
- Sanitary appliances must be removed.
- The contractor must remove accessories on doors and walls.
- Suspended ceilings must be removed.
- The contractor must remove sanitary fittings and taps.
- The contractor must remove stored sanitary fittings and accessories.
- The contractor must prepare a work plan and as-built dossier.
- The contractor must install a site installation.
- The contractor must install a site sign.
- The contractor must take protection measures.
- The contractor must follow safety regulations.
- The contractor must provide work equipment for working at height.
No specific execution details found on pages 2-7.

00.01.title: WERFINSTALLATIE

00.01.10.title: Installatie van de werf GP
00.01.10.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 7-7.

00.01.20.title: Aankondiging werf
00.01.20.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 7-7.

00.01.21.title: Werfbord GP
00.01.21.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 7-7.

00.01.40.title: Beschermingsmaatregelen PM
00.01.40.summary:
*   Beschermingsmaatregelen must be taken to protect adjacent areas from damage and dust, including cleaning if necessary.
*   The contractor must have accident and fire insurance for the building.
*   The contractor is responsible for safety measures for themselves, subcontractors, and all persons on the site.
*   The contractor provides necessary ladders and scaffolding that meet specific NBN EN standards, including stability calculations and fall protection.
*   The contractor must maintain a clean and orderly worksite, including weekly cleanups and a final cleanup before preliminary acceptance.

00.01.70.title: Veiligheidsvoorschriften
00.01.70.summary:
- Protection measures must be taken to protect adjacent areas from damage and dust using temporary means.
- The contractor is responsible for safety measures for themselves, subcontractors, and all persons on the site.
- The contractor must obtain accident and fire insurance policies for the building.
- Ladders must be provided for work at height, complying with KB 31/08/2005.
- Scaffolding must be provided, complying with NBN EN 12810 and NBN EN 12811, and a stability calculation is required.
- A clean and orderly worksite must be maintained, including weekly cleanup and final cleaning before acceptance.
- Noise and dust pollution must be minimized, complying with local regulations.
- Completed buildings/locals must be protected until provisional acceptance.

00.01.80.title: Arbeidsmiddelen – werken op hoogte
00.01.80.summary:
*   Beschermingsmaatregelen must be taken to protect adjacent areas from damage and dust using temporary means.
*   The contractor is responsible for safety measures for themselves, subcontractors, and all persons on the site.
*   The contractor must provide necessary ladders and scaffolding that meet specific NBN EN standards, including stability calculations.
*   A work planning document must be created and delivered in three copies before the start of the work.
*   An as-built dossier, including plans and technical information, must be created and delivered before the preliminary acceptance.

00.01.81.title: Arbeidsmiddelen – werken op hoogte/ladders PM
00.01.81.summary:
*   Beschermingsmaatregelen must be taken to protect adjacent areas from damage and dust using temporary means.
*   The contractor must have accident and fire insurance for the building and its furniture.
*   The contractor is responsible for safety measures for themselves, subcontractors, and all persons on the construction site.
*   The contractor must provide necessary ladders and scaffolding that meet specific NBN EN standards and KB 31/08/2005 regulations.
*   A clean and orderly construction site must be maintained, including weekly cleanups and a final cleanup before preliminary acceptance.

00.01.82.title: Arbeidsmiddelen – werken op hoogte/steigers PM
00.01.82.summary:
- During the works, the contractor must take all necessary measures to protect adjacent areas from damage and dust using temporary means like tarpaulins.
- The contractor is responsible for obtaining special accident and fire insurance policies for the building parts where work is performed.
- The contractor is responsible for all safety measures for themselves, subcontractors, and all persons allowed on the construction site.
- The contractor must ensure the work site is neat and orderly and is responsible for maintenance and regular cleanup.
- The contractor must provide machines and equipment with noise-dampening measures, especially in urban areas.

00.01.90.title: Werfcondities

00.01.91.title: Werfcondities – orde en netheid PM
00.01.91.summary:
*   The main contractor must maintain a clean and orderly worksite and is responsible for weekly cleanups of the building site and cleaning of site facilities.
*   The contractor must provide noise-reducing measures for machinery and equipment, especially in urban areas, and limit dust emissions by spraying water or using shielding tarpaulins.
*   The contractor is responsible for protecting completed buildings and/or rooms and maintaining them in good condition until provisional acceptance, potentially using building dryers or frost protection.
No specific execution details found on pages 9-9.

00.01.92.title: Werfcondities - geluids- en stofhinder PM
00.01.92.summary:
*   The main contractor must maintain a neat and orderly work site and is responsible for maintenance and regular clean-up.
*   The contractor must provide sound-absorbing materials for machines and equipment to minimize noise pollution.
*   The contractor must take necessary measures to limit dust nuisance for the environment, such as spraying with water or using shielding tarpaulins.
*   The main contractor is responsible for weekly cleaning of the construction site and cleaning of site rooms, or whenever the client, architect or safety coordinator requests it.
*   The contractor is responsible for the regular cleaning and removal of all debris, waste, and surplus materials from the site.

00.01.93.title: Werfcondities - nazorg PM
00.01.93.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 10-10.

00.01.90.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 9-10.

00.01.summary:
- The contractor must provide an installation (material and equipment) that enables them to perform the work to the satisfaction of the administration.
- The announcement of the site must be done with a site board, with specific color, dimensions, and letter type. The information to be mentioned and the guidelines for the layout are determined by the contracting authority.
- The contractor must take all necessary measures to protect adjacent rooms and spaces from damage and dust during the work, using temporary means (e.g., tarpaulins).
- The contractor is responsible for ensuring the safety of their personnel and all persons allowed on the site, taking all necessary organizational and technical measures.
- The contractor provides the necessary ladders and scaffolding, complying with KB 31/08/2005 and NBN EN 12810 and NBN EN 12811 standards, including a stability calculation for the scaffolding design.
- The main contractor establishes a neat and orderly site and is responsible for its maintenance and regular cleaning throughout the execution of the works.
- The contractor must equip their machines and equipment with all noise-reducing means available to them.
- The contractor must take necessary measures to limit nuisance to the environment for works that generate dust, such as spraying with water and/or using shielding tarpaulins.
- The contractor undertakes to protect the finished buildings and/or premises and keep them in good condition until the provisional acceptance. Where required, construction dryers, frost protection, etc. will be provided.
- A site description must be prepared at the beginning and end of the contract, including color photos clearly showing all measured zones.
- The contractor must provide a work planning schedule in Gantt chart format, on paper in 3 copies, format A3.
- The contractor must provide an as-built dossier, including execution plans, technical data sheets, assembly plans, and contact information for subcontractors, in both French and Dutch, and in a format compatible with AUTOCAD 2000 or ALLPLAN.
- The contractor must inform the Administration personnel by a competent technician according to the instructions of the leading official.
- The contractor must provide a study of the supply and discharge pipes, including definitive schemas, plattegronds, and calculation notes.
- The contractor must provide a temporary fence to close off the construction site, consisting of prefabricated panels of steel tubes with a galvanized wire mesh attached. The height of the fence is at least 1.80 m.
- The contractor must provide a layout plan of the construction site, indicating the organization and signage of traffic, the management of the main entrances, secondary entrances and temporary entrances to the construction site, the location of the construction site installations, of the storage zones or specific work zones and of any specific equipment on the construction site.
- The contractor must be responsible for the signage, lighting and marking of the construction site during the entire duration of the works and this, using appropriate means, in accordance with the traffic code and the A.R.A.B. These means must be submitted for approval to the leading official before the start of the works.
- The contractor must be responsible for the preservation, maintenance and repairs of the signage, lighting and marking of the construction site during the entire duration of the works and this, up to and including the day of the provisional acceptance.
- All signage must be made up bilingually.
- The contractor must submit a design for approval to the leading official.
- The contractor must break out light partition walls, including the demolition of wall tiles, and including the removal of the rubble outside the State domain.
- The contractor must remove a selection of exterior windows and doors, including all accessories such as wall coverings, frames, fastening systems, anchoring pins, clamps, paneling, etc.
- The contractor must remove a light, unreinforced masonry element, including the removal of the wall tiles, and including the removal of the rubble outside the State domain.
- The contractor must remove a pipe in ducts, including opening and closing the duct after removing the duct pipe.
- The contractor must remove a pipe in superstructure, including closing the openings made in the walls, ceilings and the passage through floors, using appropriate means. The repairs must be as little visible as possible.
- The contractor must remove a pipe in suspended ceilings, including dismantling the suspended ceiling, reassembling the suspended ceiling after the aforementioned works, and dismantling, storing and reassembling the electrical lighting fixtures.
- The contractor must remove plinths of all sizes, materials and structures, including removing all unnecessary fasteners, and transporting the rubble outside the State domain.
- The contractor must remove tile plinths, including the removal of all plinths in rooms where a new floor covering is placed.
- The contractor must remove flexible floor coverings, regardless of the type, thickness, fastening method, etc., as well as the laying surfaces (cork, felt, cardboard, jute, etc.).
- The contractor must break up hard coverings made of tiles, of all sizes, materials and structures, regardless of the type, dimensions, composition and laying method. This item also includes the removal of the carrier of the tiles.
- The contractor must break up wooden floor coverings of all types of wood, sizes and structures, regardless of the type, dimensions, composition and laying method.
- The contractor must break up an estrade from materials and structures of all kinds, regardless of the type, dimensions, composition and location.
- The contractor must break up screeds and industrial floors with all appropriate means, including protecting pipes of all kinds under the ground and/or in the ground, removing the existing reinforcements, cleaning the load-bearing floor, and repairing the load-bearing structures damaged by the contractor.
- The contractor must break up a screed, including all precautionary measures that are necessary to preserve the original state of the parts to be preserved, and particular attention must be paid to the drain pipe of the waste water, electrical cables, etc.
- The contractor must remove interior doors, windows, frames and moldings, including the demolition and removal of the door frame.
- The contractor must remove accessories of an interior door: door pump, floor pump, (electromagnetic) lock, door closer, doorstop, etc.
- The contractor must remove interior wall and interior column coverings, including all fasteners.
- The contractor must remove a wall covering - earthenware, including the demolition of wall tiles in the sanitary facilities and the demolition of the wall tiling in the stairwell.
- The contractor must remove accessories on the walls, and remove accessories and fasteners on the walls.
- The contractor must remove suspended ceilings, regardless of type, dimensions, composition and location, including load-bearing structures, insulation and all fasteners.
- The contractor must remove ceiling coverings, including all fasteners.
- The contractor must remove sanitary fittings and faucets, including removing all suspension or fastening means, and repairing the load-bearing structures damaged by the contractor.
- The contractor must remove a sanitary fitting, and remove stored sanitary fittings and accessories.
- The contractor must prepare and deliver a work planning schedule, and an as-built dossier.
- The contractor must provide protection measures, safety regulations, and working equipment for working at height.
- The contractor must use materials such as baked clay, loam or slate, concrete, lime sandstone or any other similar material for masonry.
- The contractor must use blocks or stones plus mortar or glue for masonry.
- The contractor must use a mortar of classes M20, M15 or M10 from NBN EN 998-2.
- The contractor must perform masonry in accordance with the requirements of NBN B 24-401 and TV no. 208.
- The contractor must use a water-repellent layer made of plastic for moisture-resistant layers in floors.
- The contractor must use glazed tiles made of finely vitrified pressed stoneware for floor coverings with tiles.
- The contractor must use glazed plinths made of finely vitrified pressed stoneware for ceramic plinths.
- The contractor must use a water-repellent interior wall plastering with cement mortar.
- The contractor must use gypsum-based interior wall plastering with factory mortar.
- The contractor must use a fixed partition wall with plasterboard on a metal structure for interior walls in carpentry.
- The contractor must use a plate to be tiled - cement plate for the lining of sanitary fittings.
- The contractor must use glazed earthenware tiles for interior wall coverings with tiles.
- The contractor must use water-repellent layers in walls.
- The contractor must use water-repellent interior wall plastering for interior wall plastering.
- The contractor must use gypsum-based interior wall plastering for interior wall plastering.
- The contractor must use a fixed partition wall with plasterboard on a metal structure for interior walls in carpentry.
- The contractor must use a plate to be tiled - cement plate for the lining of sanitary fittings.
- The contractor must use glazed earthenware tiles for interior wall coverings with tiles.
- The contractor must use water-repellent layers in walls.
- The contractor must use water-repellent interior wall plastering for interior wall plastering.
- The contractor must use gypsum-based interior wall plastering for interior wall plastering.

01.title: VOORAFGAANDE WERKEN EN SLOOPWERKEN

01.00.title: voorafgaande werken en sloopwerken
01.00.summary:
- A temporary fence must be placed to enclose the construction site, equipped with necessary lockable access points.
- The temporary fence must consist of prefabricated panels of steel tubes with galvanized wire mesh, with a minimum height of 1.80m.
- An arrangement plan of the construction site must be drawn up, indicating traffic organization, main and secondary access points, location of construction site installations, storage zones, specific work zones, and specific equipment.
- The contractor is responsible for signaling, lighting, and marking the construction site throughout the duration of the work, using appropriate means conforming to the road code and A.R.A.B.
- All signage must be made in two languages.

01.01.title: Inrichten van de bouwplaats

01.01.10.title: Voorlopige omheining
01.01.10.summary:
- At the start of the works, the contractor must place a temporary fence to close off the construction site, equipped with lockable entrances.
- The contractor must create an installation plan of the construction site, indicating the traffic organization, the location of the construction site installations, storage zones, and specific equipment.
- The contractor must ensure the signaling, lighting, and marking of the construction site during the entire duration of the works, using appropriate means, in accordance with the traffic regulations and the A.R.A.B.
- A site description must be made at the beginning and end of the works, including color photos of all measured zones.
- The contractor must provide a work planning in the form of GANTT charts.

01.01.12.title: Voorlopige omheining uit een draadnet PM
01.01.12.summary:
- At the start of the works, the contractor must place a temporary fence to close off the construction site, equipped with lockable entrances.
- The contractor must create an installation plan of the construction site, indicating the organization and signaling of traffic, the management of the main entrances, secondary entrances and temporary entrances to the construction site, the location of the construction site installations, of the storage zones or specific work zones and of any specific equipment on the construction site.
- A site description must be made at the beginning and end of the contract, including color photos.
- The contractor must provide a work planning in the form of Gantt charts.

01.01.16.title: Bebakening en signalisatie PM
01.01.16.summary:
- A temporary fence must be placed around the construction site, equipped with lockable entrances.
- An inrichtingsplan (setup plan) of the bouwplaats (construction site) must be created, indicating traffic, main entrances, and the location of construction site installations.
- Signage, lighting, and markings must be maintained throughout the duration of the works, conforming to traffic regulations.
- A "plaatsbeschrijving" (condition report) must be created at the beginning and end of the works, including color photos.
- If a werfzone (construction zone) and/or material zone is taken up outside the building, adequate signage must also be provided.
- The signage must be bilingual.

01.01.40.title: Plaatsbeschrijvingen

01.01.42.title: Plaatsbeschrijving van de binnen de bouwplaats gelegen gebouwen opgemaakt door een erkend expert
01.01.42.summary:
- A place description must be created at the beginning and end of the work, including color photos.
- Signage must be installed at the bottom of the stairs to the 2nd floor and at the closure of the work zone. All signage must be bilingual.
- The contractor must submit a work plan to the lead official before the start date of the work.
- The contractor must ensure the safety of his staff and all persons allowed on the construction site.
- The contractor must provide the necessary ladders and scaffolding.
- The contractor must provide appropriate protection against the risk of falling and against the risk of falling objects at each level of the scaffolding.
- The main contractor sets up a neat and orderly construction site and is responsible for its maintenance and regular cleaning.
- The contractor must limit noise and dust nuisance.
- The contractor undertakes to protect the finished buildings and/or premises and keep them in good condition until the provisional acceptance.
- At the start of the works, the contractor must install a temporary fence to close off the construction site. This closure is provided with the necessary lockable entrances.
- The contractor must provide for the signaling, lighting and marking of the construction site during the entire duration of the works.
- The contractor must submit a design for approval to the lead official.
- The contractor must remove demolition products to a recycling center or landfill.
- Damaged parts must be repaired by the contractor.
- The contractor must take all necessary measures to protect the adjacent premises against all damage and dust.
- The contractor must take out special accident insurance as well as fire insurance.
- The contractor must ensure that the persons working on the construction site only go to the places provided for this purpose and not to other places.
- The contractor must ensure that the persons working on the construction site only go to the places provided for this purpose and not to other places.
- The contractor must provide the necessary ladders.
- The contractor must provide the necessary scaffolding.

01.01.40.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 12-12.

01.01.summary:
- At the start of the works, the contractor must place a temporary fence to close off the construction site, equipped with lockable entrances.
- The contractor must create a site layout plan indicating traffic organization, main and secondary entrances, and the location of construction facilities, storage zones, and specific equipment.
- The contractor must provide signage, lighting, and barriers for the construction site for the entire duration of the works, conforming to traffic regulations and A.R.A.B. regulations. These must be submitted for approval before the start of work.
- A description of the existing condition must be created at the beginning and end of the works, including color photos.

01.04.title: slopen van volledige bouwwerken en van ruwbouwelementen

01.04.40.title: Slopen van metselwerk
01.04.40.summary:
- Slopen van metselwerkelementen moet zorgvuldig gebeuren om de te behouden constructiedelen niet te beschadigen.
- De aannemer moet demontage- en sloopproducten afvoeren naar een erkende recyclagecentrale of stortplaats.
- Bij het slopen van een licht ongewapend metselwerkelement (VH m²) in de sanitairen, het slopen is inclusief de afbraak van de wandbetegeling, en inclusief de afvoer van het puin buiten het Staatsdomein.
- Bij het uitnemen van buitenramen en -deuren, de vensters en de deuren die niet onmiddellijk vervangen worden, worden hermetisch afgesloten.
- Bij het verwijderen van leidingen in opbouw (VH m), het sluiten van de openingen gemaakt in de muren, plafonds en de doorgang doorheen vloeren, met aanwending van de gepaste middelen is inbegrepen.

01.04.41.title: Slopen van een metselwerkelement

01.04.41.C.title: Slopen van een licht ongewapend metselwerkelement
01.04.41.C.summary:
- Slopen van metselwerkelementen must be done carefully to avoid damaging adjacent structures.
- Demolished materials must be transported to an approved recycling center or landfill.
- Light partition walls in sanitary areas must be demolished, including wall tiles, and debris removed.
- The demolition includes the removal of wall tiles, and the removal of debris outside the State domain.

01.04.41.D.title: Slopen van een zwaar ongewapend metselwerkelement
01.04.41.D.summary:
- Slopen van zwaar ongewapend metselwerk requires approval from the lead official.
- When removing exterior windows and doors, new ones must be delivered first, and those not immediately replaced must be sealed hermetically.
- The state of all skylights will be checked, and a replacement proposal will be made and submitted to the lead official for approval before the windows are removed.
- The removal of a load-bearing masonry will only be carried out with the approval of the lead official.
- The removal of a door or window includes the frame.

01.04.41.summary:
- Metselwerk slopen moet de aannemer naar een erkende recyclagecentrale of stortplaats afvoeren.
- Bij het slopen van gevelelementen moeten nieuwe deuren en beglazing geleverd zijn, en de openingen hermetisch afgesloten.
- Bij het verwijderen van leidingen moeten de aangesloten toestellen voorzichtig afgekoppeld en de te behouden delen veiliggesteld worden.
- Bij het opbreken van vloerbedekkingen moeten voorzorgsmaatregelen genomen worden om te behouden delen te beschermen.
- Voor het slopen van zwaar metselwerk is goedkeuring van de leidend ambtenaar vereist.

01.04.summary:
- Slopen of removing metselwerkelementen includes protecting existing structures and repairing any damage caused.
- Demolition waste must be transported to an approved recycling center or landfill.
- When demolishing light interior walls in sanitary facilities, the work includes removing wall tiles and transporting debris.
- When removing exterior windows and doors, precautions must be taken to protect surrounding elements, and any damage must be repaired. Windows and doors not immediately replaced must be sealed.
- The contractor must control the condition of existing skylights and propose replacements to the project manager.

01.07.title: slopen van gevelelementen

01.07.20.title: Uitnemen van buitenramen en -deuren
01.07.20.summary:
- Slopen van gemetselde wanden/rook- en verluchtingskanalen uit zwaar metselwerk (p>2) en ongewapend, dikte dragend metselwerk vanaf 20cm dikte, afmetingen variabel, gebeurt enkel met goedkeuring van de leidend ambtenaar en inclusief afvoer van het puin buiten het Staatsdomein.
- Uitnemen van buitenramen en -deuren omvat het uitnemen van een selectie, in overleg met de leidend ambtenaar, aan buitenramen en -vensters, met inbegrip van alle toebehoren zoals muurafdekkingen, omkaderingen, bevestigingssystemen, verankeringspennen, klampen, lambriseringen, enz.
- Uiteennemen van een buitendeur of -venster (kader uit hout, enkele beglazing / isolerende beglazing / meerlagige beglazing) betreft de verwijdering van de te vervangen dakvlakramen (veluxen) na controle en goedkeuring van de leidend ambtenaar, en de verwijdering van het beschadigde raamdeurgeheel in de topgevel.

01.07.21.title: Uiteennemen van een buitendeur of -venster
01.07.21.summary:
- Slopen van zwaar metselwerk (p>2 en ongewapend) mag enkel met goedkeuring van de leidend ambtenaar.
- Bij het uitnemen van buitenramen en -deuren moeten de nieuwe deuren en beglazing geleverd zijn. Vensters en deuren die niet direct vervangen worden, moeten hermetisch afgesloten worden.
- Bij het verwijderen van leidingen in kokers moet de kokerleiding geopend en na verwijdering weer dichtgemaakt worden.
- Bij het verwijderen van plinten in lokalen waar een nieuwe vloerbedekking geplaatst wordt, moeten alle onnodige bevestigingsmiddelen verwijderd worden.
- Dakvlakramen (veluxen) worden pas verwijderd nadat de leidend ambtenaar zijn goedkeuring gegeven heeft.

01.07.summary:
- Buitenramen en deuren moeten worden uit elkaar gehaald nadat de nieuwe deuren en beglazing zijn geleverd.
- Vensters en deuren die niet onmiddellijk worden vervangen, moeten hermetisch worden afgesloten.
- Bij het verwijderen van dakvlakramen (veluxen) moet de staat van alle dakvlakramen worden gecontroleerd, en een voorstel van vervanging moet worden opgemaakt en voorgelegd aan de leidend ambtenaar.
- Leidingen van allerlei afmetingen en materialen moeten worden verwijderd, inclusief koppel-, verbindings- en bevestigingsstukken.
- Openingen in muren, plafonds en vloeren, die ontstaan door het verwijderen van leidingen, moeten worden gesloten met de gepaste middelen en zo min mogelijk zichtbaar zijn.

01.08.title: verwijderen van aan- en afvoerleidingen

01.08.30.title: Verwijderen van leidingen
01.08.30.summary:
- Verwijder leidingen of any size/material, including couplings and fixings, carefully disconnecting connected appliances.
- Secure te behouden delen en hun ophangsysteem.
- Plaats afdichtingsdoppen op te behouden leidingen.
- If the structure remains, proceed with extreme care.
- Restore damage to te behouden constructiedelen.
- Remove aan- en afvoerleidingen that cannot be recuperated, and are therefore superfluous, during the renovation of the premises.
- Leidingen worden enkel verwijderd indien dit noodzakelijk is.
- Inclusief de afvoer van het materiaal.
- Close openings in walls/ceilings/floors with appropriate means, making repairs as invisible as possible.

01.08.32.title: Verwijderen van een leiding in kokers
01.08.32.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 15-15.

01.08.33.title: Verwijderen van een leiding in opbouw
01.08.33.summary:
- Leidingen of all sizes and materials must be removed, including couplings and fixings.
- The connected devices must be carefully disconnected.
- The parts to be retained and their suspension system must be secured.
- Sealing caps must be placed on the pipes to be retained.
- If the structure is to be retained, the demolition must be carried out with extreme care.
- Damage to the building elements to be retained must be repaired.
- The rubble must be transported outside the state domain.
- When removing pipes in ducts, the duct must be opened and closed after removing the pipe.
- When removing pipes in walls or ceilings, the openings must be closed with appropriate means, making the repairs as invisible as possible.
- The removal of pipes must only be done if necessary.
- The removal includes the removal of the material.

01.08.35.title: Verwijderen van een leiding in verlaagde plafonds
01.08.35.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 16-16.

01.08.summary:
- Remove pipes of any size/material, carefully disconnecting connected devices and sealing remaining pipes.
- Open and close the pipe duct after removing the pipe.
- Close openings in walls/ceilings after pipe removal, making repairs as invisible as possible.
- Remove floor coverings and plinths in rooms where new floor coverings will be installed, taking precautions to protect adjacent areas.
- Remove tiles from walls and floors, including wall tiles in sanitary facilities and the stairwell.
- Remove light partition walls, including sanitary walls in 12 shower cubicles, and transport debris off-site.
- Remove wall and column cladding, including fasteners, and repair any damage.
- Remove suspended ceilings, including support structures, and transport debris off-site.
- Remove sanitary accessories and fittings, taking precautions to protect adjacent areas.
- Remove sanitary appliances, sealing any remaining pipes.
- Remove stored sanitary equipment and accessories, transporting them off-site or to a designated storage area.

01.09.title: verwijderen van vloerbedekkingen en dekvloeren

01.09.10.title: Verwijderen van plinten

01.09.11.title: Verwijderen van een plint

01.09.11.A.title: Verwijderen van tegel plinten
01.09.11.A.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 16-16.

01.09.11.B.title: Verwijderen van houten plinten
01.09.11.B.summary:
- Plinten must be removed in rooms where new flooring is installed, including wood and tile plinths in sanitary areas and the stairwell.
- Existing flexible floor coverings must be removed, regardless of type, thickness, or attachment method, and the subfloor must be carefully cleaned to remove adhesive residue.
- Hard tile floor coverings must be broken up, regardless of size, material, or structure, including removal of the tile backing.
- Soft floor coverings must be removed in the rooms, hallway, and landing on the stairwell on the 2nd floor.
- The contractor must repair any damage to retained construction elements during floor covering removal.

01.09.11.summary:
- Remove plinths in locations where new flooring will be installed, including wood and tile plinths in sanitary areas and the stairwell.
- Remove piping from ducts, in-wall, and suspended ceilings, including opening and closing the ducts, walls, or ceilings.
- Remove flexible floor coverings in specified locations, including the gang, and the landing on the stairwell on the 2nd floor.
- Break up tile floor coverings in the sanitary facilities (level +1 and entresol), including removal of the rubble outside the State domain.
- Signalization must be bilingual.

01.09.10.summary:
- Plinten must be removed in locations where new flooring will be installed, including wood and tile plinths in sanitary areas and the stairwell.
- Existing flexible floor coverings must be removed, including the adhesive and leveling layers, and the subfloor must be cleaned to remove all traces of glue or other residue.
- Tile plinths must be removed from the sanitary areas and stairwell, and the removal includes the disposal of debris outside the State domain.
- Pipes must be removed from suspended ceilings, including dismantling the suspended ceiling, reassembling it after work, and removing, storing, and reassembling electrical lighting fixtures.
- The contractor must remove all plinths in locations where new flooring is to be installed, including wooden and tile plinths in the sanitary areas and stairwell.
- Flexible floor coverings must be removed, regardless of type, thickness, or attachment method, along with any leveling layers (cork, felt, cardboard, jute, etc.). The exposed screed must be carefully cleaned to remove all glue residue or other deposits.
- Tile floor coverings must be removed, regardless of size, material, structure, composition, or laying method, including the removal of the tile backing.
- Pipes must be removed in ducts, including opening and closing the duct after pipe removal.
- Pipes must be removed in surface-mounted installations, including closing openings in walls, ceilings, and floors, and restoring the affected areas.
- Pipes must be removed in suspended ceilings, including dismantling the suspended ceiling, reassembling it after work, and removing, storing, and reassembling electrical lighting fixtures.

01.09.30.title: Verwijderen van soepele vloerbedekkingen
01.09.30.summary:
- Plinten must be removed in rooms where new flooring is placed, including wooden and tile plinths in sanitary areas and the stairwell.
- Existing flexible floor coverings must be removed, regardless of type, thickness, or attachment method, and the subfloor must be carefully cleaned to remove all traces of glue or other residue.
- Flexible floor coverings must be removed from rooms, hallways, and landings on the 2nd floor.
- Hard tile floor coverings must be broken up, regardless of size, material, or structure, including removal of the tile backing.
- The contractor must take precautions to protect adjacent areas from damage and dust during demolition and cleaning.

01.09.31.title: Verwijderen van een soepele vloerbedekking
01.09.31.summary:
- Plinten must be removed in locations where new flooring will be installed, including wood and tile plinths in sanitary rooms and the stairwell.
- Existing flexible floor coverings must be removed, regardless of type, thickness, or attachment method, and the subfloor must be carefully cleaned to remove all traces of glue or other residue.
- Hard floor coverings made of tiles must be broken up, regardless of size, material, structure, or laying method, including removal of the tile backing.
- The page specifies the removal of flexible floor coverings in the rooms, the hallway, and the landing on the stairwell on the 2nd floor.

01.09.40.title: Opbreken van vloerbedekkingen uit tegels
01.09.40.summary:
- Existing flexible floor coverings (linoleum/PVC/rubber/cork tiles/glued carpet/stretched carpet) must be removed in the rooms, hallway, and landing on the 2nd floor.
- Hard tile floor coverings must be broken up, including the tile carrier.
- All necessary precautions must be taken to protect the existing construction.
- The contractor must remove all waste outside the state domain.

01.09.41.title: Opbreken van een vloerbedekking uit tegels
01.09.41.summary:
- Tegelvloeren in de sanitairen (niveau +1 en niveau entresol) moeten worden verwijderd, inclusief de afvoer van het puin.
- Houten vloerbedekking (OSB-platen) die in slechte staat verkeren, moeten worden afgebroken en afgevoerd.
- Lichte scheidingswanden moeten worden afgebroken.
- Binnenwand- en binnenkolombekleding moet worden verwijderd, inclusief bevestigingsmiddelen.
- Tegelplinten in sanitaire ruimten en de traphal moeten worden verwijderd.

01.09.50.title: Opbreken van houten vloerbedekkingen
01.09.50.summary:
- Existing tile flooring in the sanitaires (level +1 and entresol) must be removed, including the removal of the stabilized sand bedding.
- Existing wooden flooring (OSB plates) that are in very poor condition must be removed.
- Small amounts of OSB plates must be locally removed where new drainage pipes need to be installed.
- Tile plinths must be removed in areas where new flooring will be installed, including sanitary rooms and the stairwell.
- The contractor must break up tile flooring in the sanitary facilities (level +1 and entresol).

01.09.51.title: Opbreken van een houten vloerbedekking
01.09.51.summary:
- Existing tile flooring in the sanitary facilities (level +1 and entresol) must be removed, including the stabilized sand bed, and disposed of outside the State domain.
- Existing small amounts of OSB plates in very poor condition are to be broken up and removed.
- Existing estrades under the shower cells (4 in total) are to be demolished.
- Lightly reinforced masonry elements are to be demolished, including wall tiling, and the debris is to be removed outside the State domain.
- A selection of exterior windows and doors must be removed, after the new doors and glazing have been delivered, and the openings must be hermetically sealed.

01.09.52.title: Opbreken van estrade
01.09.52.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 19-19.

01.09.60.title: Opbreken van dekvloeren en bedrijfsvloeren
01.09.60.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 19-19.

01.09.61.title: Opbreken van een dekvloer
01.09.61.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 19-19.

01.09.summary:
- Remove plinths in locations where new flooring will be installed, including wood and tile plinths in sanitary areas and the stairwell.
- Remove pipes in ducts, open and close the duct after pipe removal, and remove pipes in suspended ceilings, including dismantling and reassembling the ceiling and lighting.
- Remove tile plinths by removing a plinth made of stone.
- Remove flexible floor coverings in rooms, hallways, and stairwell landings on the 2nd floor.
- Remove accessories from interior doors, taking care to protect the doors and surrounding structures.
- Dismantle false ceilings of all materials, including load-bearing structures, insulation, and fasteners.
- Dismantle sanitary appliances and fittings, including removing all fixings and restoring damaged structures.
- Create as-built drawings and documentation.
- Install temporary fencing.
- Create a site plan.
- The contractor is responsible for safety.
- Scaffolding must meet NBN EN 12810 and NBN EN 12811 standards.
- The contractor must provide a design for the scaffolding.
- Scaffolding must be secured to prevent movement.
- The scaffolding must be protected against falling objects.
- The contractor must clean the site weekly.
- The contractor must limit noise and dust.
- The contractor must protect finished buildings.
- The contractor must provide a work schedule.
- The contractor must create a site plan.
- The contractor must create a demolition plan.
- The contractor must remove waste to an approved recycling center.
- The contractor must remove asbestos.

01.10.title: slopen van binnenwandelementen

01.10.20.title: Verwijderen van binnendeuren, -vensters, kozijnen en omlijstingen
01.10.20.summary:
- Binnendeuren must be removed, including the door frame, and transported off-site.
- Binnenramen must be removed, including the frame and glass, and transported off-site.
- Accessories on binnendeuren (door pumps, floor pumps, etc.) must be removed, with care taken to protect the surrounding construction.
- Light inner walls must be demolished and removed off-site.
- Inner wall and column cladding must be removed, including all fasteners, and transported off-site.

01.10.21.title: Verwijderen van een binnendeur
01.10.21.summary:
- Remove binnendeuren (FH st), binnenvensters (VH m²), and accessories from binnendeuren (GP).
- Ausbrechen leichte Innenwände (GP) und Innenwand- und Innenkolombekledingen (VH m²).
- Remove abgehängte Decken (VH m²) und Deckenverkleidungen (VH m²).
- Remove sanitair toebehoren en kraanwerk (GP) and sanitaire toestellen (FH st).
- Afvoer gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen en toebehoren (GP).

01.10.22.title: Verwijderen van een binnenvenster
01.10.22.summary:
- Remove binnendeuren (FH st) including the door frame.
- Remove binnenvensters (VH m²) including the window (glass).
- Remove accessories from binnendeuren (GP) such as door pumps, floor pumps, and door closers.
- Break out lichte binnenwanden (GP), including sanitary walls of 12 shower cubicles, and remove debris.
- Remove binnenwand- en binnenkolombekledingen (VH m²), including all fasteners.
- Remove binnenwandbekleding - faience (VH m²).
- Remove accessories on the walls (GP).

01.10.25.title: Verwijderen van accesoires binnendeuren
01.10.25.summary:
- Remove binnendeuren (FH st), binnenvensters (VH m²), and accessories from binnendeuren (GP).
- Break out lichte binnenwanden (GP).
- Remove binnenwand- and binnenkolombekledingen (VH m²).
- Remove verlaagde plafonds (VH m²) and plafondbekledingen (VH m²).
- Remove sanitair toebehoren and kraanwerk (GP) and sanitair toestellen (FH st).
- Remove gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen and toebehoren (GP).

01.10.summary:
- Remove binnendeuren, binnenvensters, kozijnen, and omlijstingen.
- Break out light inner walls and remove inner wall and column cladding.
- Remove lowered ceilings and ceiling cladding.
- Remove accessories on the walls, sanitary equipment, and sanitary accessories and tapware.
- The contractor must take measures to protect adjacent areas during demolition.
- The contractor is responsible for repairing any damage caused during demolition.
- All demolition debris must be removed from the site.

01.08.35.title: Verwijderen van een leiding in verlaagde plafonds VH m
01.08.35.summary:
- The contractor must remove plinths in locations where new flooring is installed, including wood and tile plinths in sanitary areas and the stairwell.
- For flexible flooring removal, the contractor must carefully clean the exposed subfloor to remove all traces of adhesive.
- For tile flooring removal, the contractor must also remove the tile backing.
- The contractor must remove pipes in shafts and in-wall, including opening and closing the shaft after pipe removal.
- The contractor must remove tile plinths made of stone.

01.14.title: verwijderen van sanitaire toestellen

01.14.10.title: Verwijderen van sanitair toebehoren en kraanwerk
01.14.10.summary:
- Verlaagde plafonds op metalen draagconstructie moeten worden gesloopt, inclusief de demontage van de onderliggende draagconstructie.
- Plafondbekledingen gemaakt van kunststof lamellen moeten worden gesloopt, inclusief de demontage van de bovenliggende draagconstructie.
- Sanitair toebehoren en kraanwerk moeten worden weggenomen, inclusief alle ophang- of bevestigingsmiddelen.
- Sanitaire toestellen moeten worden verwijderd, waarbij alle te behouden leidingen hermetisch afgesloten moeten worden.
- Gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen en toebehoren op de 2de verdieping moeten worden afgevoerd.

01.14.11.title: Verwijderen van sanitair toebehoren
01.14.11.summary:
- Verwijder sanitair toebehoren zoals spiegels, gordijnen, en zeepbakjes, and transport them outside the state domain.
- Remove gootstenen, closetpotten, wastafels, urinoirs, and uitgietbakken, and transport them outside the state domain.
- Remove gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen and toebehoren from the 2nd floor.

01.14.20.title: Verwijderen van sanitaire toestellen
01.14.20.summary:
- Verwijder sanitair toebehoren (spiegel, gordijn, etc.) en afvoeren buiten het Staatsdomein.
- Verwijder sanitaire toestellen (closetpot, wastafel, urinoir, etc.) en afvoeren buiten het Staatsdomein.
- Verwijder gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen (toiletten, wastafels, urinoirs) op de 2de verdieping en afvoeren buiten het Staatsdomein of naar een opslagplaats.

01.14.21.title: Verwijderen van een sanitair toestel
01.14.21.summary:
- Verwijder sanitair toebehoren zoals spiegels, gordijnen, etc. en voer het af.
- Verwijder gootstenen, closetpotten, wastafels, urinoirs, en uitgietbakken en voer het af.
- Afvoer gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen en toebehoren (gootstenen, closetpotten, etc.) van de 2e verdieping.

01.14.22.title: Afvoer gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen en toebehoren
01.14.22.summary:
- Verwijder sanitair toebehoren (spiegel, gordijn, etc.) en afvoer buiten het Staatsdomein.
- Verwijder gootsteen/closetpot/wastafel/urinoir en afvoer buiten het Staatsdomein.
- Afvoer gestockeerde sanitaire toestellen (toiletten, wastafels, urinoirs) en materiaal van de 2de verdieping.
- The aannemer must provide a "as built" dossier with specific information and documentation.

01.14.summary:
- Verlaagde plafonds in lokaal 02.25 must be removed, including the underlying metal support structure.
- A ceiling covering made of plastic slats in lokaal 02.03, 02.05 en 02.23 must be removed, including the supporting structure.
- Remove all sanitary equipment and fittings, including taps and accessories.
- Remove and dispose of all stocked sanitary equipment and accessories located on the 2nd floor.
- A work planning and as-built dossier must be created and delivered.
- Signalisation must be placed at the bottom of the stairs to the 2nd floor, at the closure of the work zone.
- A place description must be made at the beginning and end of the work.
- The contractor must inform the personnel of the Administration by a competent technician according to the instructions of the leading official.

03.02.title: MUREN EN TUSSENWANDEN VAN METSELWERK UIT KLEINE ELEMENTEN

03.02.00.title: Muren en tussenwanden van metselwerk – Algemeen (F)
03.02.00.summary:
- The contractor must provide an installation (material and equipment) that enables them to perform the work to the satisfaction of the administration.
- The contractor must erect a temporary fence to close off the construction site, equipped with lockable entrances. The fence must consist of prefabricated panels with steel tubes and galvanized wire mesh, and be at least 1.80m high.
- The contractor must create an installation plan indicating traffic organization, main entrances, stock zones, and specific work zones.
- The contractor must provide a work schedule in Gantt chart format on paper (3 copies, A3 size).
- The "AS BUILT" dossier must be created in three copies and include execution plans, technical data sheets, assembly plans, and contact information for subcontractors.
- Walls/partitions must be made of masonry with small elements, using blocks/stones plus mortar or adhesive.
- The blocks and stones must have the BENOR quality label or equivalent.
- The contractor must use a recycling center and/or landfill that is approved by the administration.
- The contractor must remove demolition products to an approved recycling center and/or landfill.
- The contractor must control the condition of the existing roof windows (Velux) and propose replacements if needed.
- The contractor must carefully remove exterior windows and doors, protecting surrounding elements.
- The contractor must remove pipes of all sizes and materials, including couplings and fasteners.
- The contractor must remove plinths of all sizes, materials and structures.
- The contractor must remove flexible floor coverings, carefully cleaning the subfloor.
- The contractor must break up tile floor coverings.
- The contractor must break up screeds and industrial floors.
- The contractor must remove interior wall elements.
- The contractor must remove suspended ceilings.
- The contractor must remove sanitary appliances.
- The contractor must remove sanitary accessories and faucets.
- The contractor must remove stored sanitary appliances and accessories.
- The contractor must erect non-load-bearing walls and partitions from masonry of small elements, using perforated blocks and stones.
- The contractor must use baked clay, loam, or slate; concrete; lime-sandstone; or other similar material.
- The contractor must use blocks or stones plus mortar or adhesive.
- The contractor must use masonry that can bear its own weight and that of the usual equipment.
- The contractor must mechanically connect masonry partitions to concrete columns or walls every 60 cm.
- The contractor must use masonry that ensures a load-bearing function.
- The contractor must incorporate electrical conduits into visible masonry.
- The contractor must use stones in large quantities for visible and facade masonry.
- The contractor must use soundproofing materials for sound insulation.
- The contractor must use a mortar of class M20, M15 or M10 from NBN EN 998-2.
- The contractor must execute masonry according to NBN B 24-401 and TV nr. 208.
- The contractor must use materials that are compatible with each other.

03.02.10.title: Muren en scheidingswanden uit metselwerk van baksteen – Algemeen (F)
03.02.10.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 35-35.

03.02.13.title: Niet-dragende muren en scheidingswanden uit metselwerk van baksteen – Metselwerk uit blokken en stenen ander dan gevelmetselwerk – Geperforeerde blokken en stenen (F)
03.02.13.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 35-35.

03.02.summary:
- Mortar for masonry must conform to NBN EN 998-2, with specific classes (M20, M15, M10, M5, M2.5) indicated.
- Bricks must be BENOR certified or equivalent.
- Bricks must be laid according to NBN B 24-401 and TV 208.
- Walls must be mechanically connected to columns or concrete walls every 60cm.
- For visible masonry, stones must be mixed to avoid color variations.
- The SO4 content of stones and mortar must be checked to prevent efflorescence.
- Wood for carpentry must meet STS 04 standards and be treated with an A1 process (STS 04.31).
- OSB panels must meet EN 300 and NBN EN 12 369-1 standards, category OSB/2, and be well anchored.
- Control dimensions of existing beam layer (75x200mm) with heart-to-heart distance of 36cm.

01.summary:
- The contractor must erect a temporary fence around the construction site with lockable access points.
- The contractor is responsible for making an implementation plan of the construction site, including traffic management, main and secondary entrances, and placement of construction equipment.
- The contractor must prepare a place description before and after the renovation, including color photos of the measured zones.
- Demolition of light partition walls includes the removal of wall tiles and disposal of debris outside the State domain.
- When removing windows, the contractor must ensure the new windows and glazing are delivered and hermetically seal any openings.
- The contractor must provide a work planning document in Gantt chart format.
- The contractor must provide an as-built dossier with specific documents and information.
- For masonry work, the contractor must use BENOR-certified or equivalent blocks and stones.
- For masonry work, the contractor must use mortar of class M20, M15, or M10 according to NBN EN 998-2.
- The contractor must protect adjacent areas from damage and dust using temporary means.
- The contractor must provide necessary ladders and scaffolding that meet specific safety standards.
- The contractor must maintain a clean and orderly worksite, including weekly cleanups and proper waste disposal.
- The contractor must use noise-reducing equipment and limit dust generation.
- The contractor must protect completed buildings and/or rooms until the preliminary acceptance.

03.title: OPEN RUWBOUW

03.00.title: OPEN RUWBOUW
03.00.summary:
- The document specifies various standards (NBN, EN, STS, TV) that apply to materials and execution.
- For masonry, the document details requirements for materials like bricks, blocks, mortar, cement, lime, and sand, including specific standards and properties (e.g., compressive strength, water absorption). It also specifies execution standards (NBN B 24-401).
- For wood elements, the document specifies wood quality (STS 04.2), treatment (A1-procédé), and moisture content. It also mentions standards for OSB panels (EN 300, NBN EN 12 369-1).
- For painting, the document specifies the type of paint (alkydharsen in dispersie), solid content, and gloss level.
- The document specifies the creation of an "AS BUILT" dossier, including plans, technical data sheets, and montage plans.
- The document specifies the installation of a construction site, including a fence, a sign, and safety measures.
No specific execution details found on pages 29-29.

03.02.title: MUREN EN TUSSENWANDEN VAN METSELWERK UIT KLEINE ELEMENTEN

03.02.00.title: Muren en tussenwanden van metselwerk – Algemeen (F)
03.02.00.summary:
- Metselwerk slopen must include removing wall tiling and transporting debris off-site.
- When removing exterior windows/doors, the new ones must be delivered first, and any not immediately replaced must be sealed hermetically.
- For light masonry demolition, prior approval from the lead official is required.
- For visible masonry, stones must be mixed before processing to avoid color and texture differences in the wall surfaces.
- For timber work, wood must be treated with an A1 process and delivered sufficiently dry.

03.02.summary:
- The contractor must provide an installation (material and equipment) that enables him to carry out the work to the satisfaction of the administration.
- The contractor must erect a temporary fence to enclose the construction site, with lockable access points. The fence must be made of prefabricated steel tube panels with a galvanized wire mesh. The height of the fence must be at least 1.80 m.
- The contractor must make an installation plan of the construction site, indicating the organization and signage of traffic, the management of the main entrances, secondary entrances and temporary entrances, the location of the construction site installations, storage zones or specific work zones, and any specific equipment on the construction site.
- The contractor must submit a work schedule to the lead official in work or calendar days.
- The "AS BUILT" dossier must be prepared in three copies and include the execution plans of the works and installations as they were carried out, approved technical sheets of all equipment and accessories, assembly plans of the equipment, the name, full address and telephone number of all subcontractors, and an electronic copy of the AS BUILT plans compatible with AUTOCAD 2000 or ALLPLAN.
- The contractor must demolish masonry elements of interior and/or exterior walls of any stone material (concrete blocks, facing stones, etc.) including lintels, sills, wall blocks, natural stone plinths, anchors, hooks, cavity fillings as well as any material, within the limits of the masonry to be demolished, regardless of the height and taking care not to damage the construction parts to be preserved.
- The contractor must remove the plinths of all kinds of dimensions, materials and structures.
- The contractor must remove the pipes of all sizes and materials, including all coupling, connecting and fastening pieces, regardless of the presence of other pipes and construction parts.
- The contractor must remove false ceilings of all materials and constructions; regardless of type, dimensions, composition and location, including supporting structures, insulation and all fasteners.
- The contractor must remove the sanitary fittings and accessories.
- The contractor must prepare a place description at the beginning and end of the works.
- Walls and partitions must be made of masonry of small elements.
- The contractor must use blocks or stones plus mortar or glue.
- The blocks and stones must have the BENOR quality label or equivalent.
- The contractor must use baked clay, loam or shale, concrete, sand-lime brick or any other similar material.
- The contractor must use fine sand according to the NBN B 11-011 standard.
- The contractor must perform the masonry work in accordance with the requirements of the NBN B 24-401 standard.
- The contractor must protect adjacent premises against damage and dust using temporary means.
- The contractor must provide ladders and scaffolding.
- The contractor must provide machines and equipment with noise-reducing devices.
- The contractor must take measures to limit dust.
- The contractor must protect the finished buildings and/or premises and keep them in good condition until the provisional acceptance.
- The contractor must remove the stored sanitary equipment and accessories.
- The contractor must make a work planning.
- The contractor must make an as-built dossier.
- The contractor must make a safety file.
- The contractor must make a maintenance file.
- The contractor must inform the personnel of the Administration.
- The contractor must provide a reserved sum for unforeseen work.

03.02.13.title: Niet-dragende muren en scheidingswanden uit metselwerk van baksteen – Metselwerk uit blokken en stenen ander dan gevelmetselwerk – Geperforeerde blokken en stenen (F)
03.02.13.summary:
- For masonry work, the contractor must adhere to norms NBN B 24-401 and TV nr. 208, and must communicate the address of the recycling center/landfill used.
- For visible masonry, stones must be mixed before processing to avoid color/texture differences.
- For light non-load-bearing masonry, mechanical connections to columns/walls are required every 60cm.
- For timber work, wood must be treated with an A1-procédé (STS 04.31) and delivered sufficiently dry, and wood in contact with masonry must be painted with 2 layers of red lead.
- For OSB panels, category OSB/2 with a thickness of 18mm must be used and well anchored to existing panels and underlying beams.
- For doorframes, a soundproofing material must be used between the frame and the wall.
- For painting, the surface must be prepared according to the specifications, and a minimum of 3 coats must be applied.
- For tiling, the contractor must use a mortar that is compatible with the tiles and the substrate.

03.14.title: HOUTEN STRUCTUURELEMENTEN

03.14.20.title: Timmerwerk uit hout
03.14.20.summary:
- For non-load-bearing masonry walls using blocks and stones other than facade masonry, the dry apparent volume mass must be class p 1 (< 1000 kg/m3).
- The blocks and stones must be mortared.
- The timber used for carpentry must meet STS 04 standards and be treated with an A1 process (STS 04.31).
- Delivered wood must be sufficiently dry according to STS 04.1.
- Execution and calculations must adhere to STS 31.0 and STS 32.0.
- Wood in contact with masonry must be painted with 2 coats of red lead.
- Steel connecting pieces must be painted with two coats of red lead.
- Wood must be protected against moisture and dirt.
- Direct contact with mortar, coating, etc., must be avoided.
- Bolts must be driven into their holes during assembly, using a template.
- Metal mounting parts must meet the Rf criterion.
- Connection connectors must have a technical approval (ATG) or equivalent.
- The contractor must perform a sounding check to verify the dimensions of the beam layer and their center-to-center distance.
- OSB/2 panels with a thickness of 18mm must be placed on the existing panels and well anchored through the existing panels and into the underlying beam layer.
- The center-to-center distance of the existing beam layer must be checked by sounding.

03.14.21.title: Houten balken

03.14.21.D.title: Controle van de balkenlaag
03.14.21.D.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 40-40.

03.14.21.summary:
- A "sonderende controle" (sounding control) of the dimensions of the existing beam layer must be performed.
- The OSB/2 panels with a thickness of 18mm must be well anchored through the existing panels and into the underlying beam layer.
- The KB (Koninklijk Besluit, Royal Decree) concerning the use of work equipment for temporary work at height (KB 31/08/2005 and any additions, amendments) is applicable.
- The contractor must provide the necessary ladders and scaffolding.
- The contractor must provide an installation that enables him to carry out the works to the satisfaction of the administration.

03.14.30.title: Panelen vervaardigd op basis van hout (S)
03.14.30.summary:
- The contractor must perform a "sonderende controle" to check the dimensions of the "balkenlaag" (joist system) and their center-to-center spacing.
- OSB/2 panels with a thickness of 18mm must be installed on the existing panels and well-anchored through the existing panels into the underlying joist system.
- The center-to-center spacing of the existing joist system must be checked using "sonderingen".

03.14.32.title: Panelen vervaardigd met dunne, lange georiënteerde lamellen (OSB) (S)
03.14.32.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 40-40.

03.14.summary:
- For non-load-bearing masonry walls, mechanically connect them to columns or concrete walls every 60 cm.
- Treat wood with an A1-procédé according to S.T.S. 04.31, and provide the lead engineer with the attestation.
- Wood delivered to the construction site must be sufficiently dry according to STS 04.1.
- Treat wood in contact with masonry with two coats of red lead paint.
- Steel connecting pieces must be painted with two coats of red lead paint.
- The contractor must perform a sondering control to verify the dimensions and center-to-center distance of the beam layer.
- OSB/2 panels with a thickness of 18mm must be placed on existing panels and well anchored through the existing panels and into the underlying beam layer.

03.summary:
- The contractor must obtain BENOR or equivalent quality labels for blocks and stones used in masonry.
- Mortar must be of class M20, M15, or M10 according to NBN EN 998-2.
- Masonry work must comply with NBN B 24-401 and TV nr. 208.
- The contractor must provide a work schedule in Gantt chart format (A3 paper, 3 copies).
- An "AS BUILT" dossier must be created in three copies, compatible with AUTOCAD 2000 or ALLPLAN.
No specific execution details found on pages 29-40.

07.title: GEVELSLUITINGEN.

07.01.title: BUITENDEUREN EN -VENSTERS

07.01.00.title: Buitendeuren en -vensters – Algemeen (F)
07.01.00.summary:
- Buitendeuren en vensters moeten voldoen aan de algemene prestatiecriteria inzake luchtdoorlaat, waterdichtheid, mechanische sterkte, en sterkte tegen wind.
- Houten profielen moeten gebeitst of geverfd worden.
- De aannemer moet de SO4gehalte onderzoeken alsook de verenigbaarheid van de mortel en de stenen zodat uitbloeiingen en verwering van de voeg- en legmortel vermeden worden.
- De aannemer moet een ontwerp ter goedkeuring voorleggen aan de leidende ambtenaar.
- De aannemer moet de afmetingen van de balkenlaag controleren, alsook hun tussenafstand hart-op-hart.
- Panelen moeten goed verankerd worden doorheen de bestaande panelen en in de onderliggende balkenlaag.
- De aannemer moet een inrichtingsplan van de bouwplaats opmaken waarop minstens aangeduid staat de organisatie en de signalisatie van het verkeer, het beheer van de hoofdtoegangen, secundaire toegangen en voorlopige toegangen tot de bouwplaats.
- De aannemer moet instaan voor de signalisatie, verlichting en bebakening van de bouwplaats tijdens de ganse duur van de werken en dit, met behulp van de geschikte middelen, conform de wegcode en het A.R.A.B.
- De aannemer moet instaan voor het behoud, het onderhoud en de herstellingen van de signalisatie, verlichting en bebakening van de bouwplaats tijdens de ganse duur van de werken en dit, tot en met de dag van de voorlopige oplevering.

07.01.10.title: Houten profielen – algemeen (F)
07.01.10.summary:
- Houten buitendeuren and windows must be made of wood that meets STS 04 quality standards.
- The wood must be treated with a C1 process according to STS 04.33.1 before installation.
- The wood must be painted with a minimum of 3 layers of non-film-forming paint after degreasing.
- During demolition, window frames and doors must be removed after the new doors and glazing are delivered, and the openings must be sealed hermetically.

07.01.summary:
- Aannemer moet een werkplanning opmaken en leveren.
- Aannemer moet een as-builtdossier opmaken en leveren (civiele bouwkunde, elektriciteit, HVAC).
- Slopen van metselwerk inclusief afvoer van puin buiten het Staatsdomein.
- Bij slopen van gevelelementen, nieuwe deuren en beglazing moeten geleverd zijn vooraleer de oude elementen verwijderd worden.
- Verwijderen van leidingen, inclusief afkoppelen van toestellen, veilig stellen van te behouden delen, en plaatsen van afdichtingsdoppen.

07.02.title: BUITENBEGLAZING EN VULELEMENTEN

07.02.00.title: Buitenbeglazing en vulelementen – algemeen (F)
07.02.00.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 56-59.

07.02.20.title: Isolerende beglazing – algemeen (F)
07.02.20.summary:
- Isolerende beglazing must meet STS 38.03, 38.05 and the manufacturer's instructions.
- The glass must be fixed with an elastic kit of class VI according to STS 38.03.61 or an elastic sealing profile of class A according to STS 38.03.62.1.
- The contractor must provide a guarantee of 10 years against clouding of the glazing.

07.02.21.title: Isolerende beglazing – klaar glas (F)
07.02.21.summary:
- The contractor must provide a werfbord (site sign) with white panel, dimensions circa 300 x 200 cm, and black letters in a simple, clean font. The support structure consists of metal tubes anchored to concrete bases. The contractor must submit a design for approval to the leading official.
- The contractor must ensure weekly cleanup of the construction site and cleaning of site facilities, or whenever the client, architect, or safety coordinator requests.
- The contractor must ensure a thorough cleaning of the entire site, both inside and outside the buildings, before the provisional acceptance.
- For masonry work, the contractor must use blocks or stones plus mortar or adhesive.
- For masonry work, the contractor must transport the demolition and/or demolition products to a recycling center and/or landfill.
- For light, non-reinforced masonry elements, the contractor must demolish light partition walls, mainly located in the sanitary facilities.
- For removing exterior windows and doors, the contractor must hermetically seal the windows and doors that are not immediately replaced.
- For removing pipes, the contractor must carefully disconnect the connected devices.
- For removing flexible floor coverings, the contractor must carefully clean the exposed screed to remove all traces of glue or other deposits.
- For removing tiles, the contractor must also remove the carrier of the tiles.
- For removing a wooden floor, the contractor must carefully clean the load-bearing floor parts located under the ground.
- For removing a wooden floor, the contractor must remove OSB plates that are in very poor condition.
- For the installation of a temporary fence, prefabricated panels of steel tubes with a galvanized wire mesh attached must be used. The height of the fence is at least 1.80 m.
- The contractor must prepare an installation plan of the construction site, indicating the organization and signaling of traffic, the management of the main entrances, secondary entrances and temporary entrances to the construction site.
- The contractor must provide the documents concerning the planning in the form of graphic documents, in the form of planning of the type GANTT, on paper in 3 copies format A3.
- The contractor must make an as-built dossier in three copies, including a table of contents, the execution plans, the technical sheets, the assembly plans, the names and addresses of all subcontractors, and an electronic copy compatible with AUTOCAD 2000 or ALLPLAN.
- The contractor must provide a work clothing that is resistant to wear and tear.
- The contractor must provide a mortar of the classes M20, M15 or M10.
- The contractor must provide a cement of the type CEM I, CEM II, CEM III or CEM V.
- The contractor must provide a sand that has a grain size distribution between 0.08 and 2 mm and does not contain more than 0.05% organic substances.

07.02.30.title: Thermisch verbeterde beglazing – algemeen (F)

- The contractor must submit a work planning, as-built dossier (civil, electrical, HVAC), and operating manual dossier for approval.
- The contractor must provide a temporary fence, signalization, and lighting.
- The contractor must perform demolition work, including removing doors, windows, walls, floors, ceilings, and sanitary equipment.
- The contractor must install water-resistant plasterboard and cement board.

07.02.54.title: Veiligheidsbeglazing - thermisch isolerend / gehard (F) PM..
07.02.54.summary:
- The contractor must provide a work installation that enables them to perform the work to the satisfaction of the administration.
- The contractor is responsible for weekly cleaning of the construction site and must take measures to keep access routes clean.
- The contractor must provide all necessary organizational and technical measures to ensure the safety of personnel and visitors on site.
- Scaffolding must meet NBN EN 12810 and NBN EN 12811 standards, and a stability calculation must be performed to determine the design.
- The contractor must submit a work planning in Gantt chart format (A3 paper, 3 copies) to the lead official before the start date.
- An 'as-built' dossier must be created, including execution plans, technical data sheets, and montage plans, compatible with AUTOCAD 2000 or ALLPLAN.
- The contractor must provide a list of addresses and phone numbers of all subcontractors.
- The contractor must provide operating manuals for automated installations in French and Dutch.
- The contractor must provide safety glazing that meets STS 38.12, STS 38.08.57 and NBN EN 572 1 to 9 standards.
- The contractor must provide a 10-year warranty against clouding due to condensation or dust formation in the safety glazing.

07.02.summary:
- The aannemer must submit a work planning, as-built dossier (civil engineering, electricity, HVAC), and operating manual dossier before the provisional acceptance.
- For masonry, the aannemer must use materials with BENOR or equivalent quality label.
- For woodworks, the aannemer must use wood that meets STS 04 standards, is treated with an A1 process, and has a moisture content below 18%.
- For painting, the aannemer must use materials that are compatible with the substrate and apply them according to the manufacturer's instructions.
- For sanitary installations, the aannemer must ensure that the materials are corrosion-resistant and that the installation is leak-proof and functions silently.

07.summary:
- Buitendeuren en vensters moeten voldoen aan specifieke prestatiecriteria zoals luchtdoorlaat, waterdichtheid, mechanische sterkte, en windweerstand.
- Houten profielen moeten gebeitst of geverfd worden volgens specifieke procedures en met materialen die voldoen aan STS normen.
- Hang- en sluitwerk moet maximaal ingewerkt zijn en gemakkelijk vervangbaar.
- Isolerende beglazing moet voldoen aan STS normen en de k-waarde moet maximaal 2.0 W/m²K zijn (of lager voor thermisch verbeterde beglazing).
- Afvoerleidingen moeten een constante helling hebben (1-3 cm/m) en bevestigd worden met beugels die uitzetting toelaten; specifieke materialen en afmetingen zijn voorgeschreven.
- Cementgebonden dekvloeren moeten voldoen aan TV 189 en druksterkte van minimum 8 N/mm2.
- Keramische tegels moeten voldoen aan NBN EN 14411 en geplaatst worden met open voegen en een voegkleur aangepast aan de tegel.
- Vochtwerende lagen in vloeren moeten overlappen met minstens 0.30m en tegen de muren opgetrokken worden tot 2cm boven het afgewerkte vloerpeil.
- Gipskartonplaten voor wanden moeten voldoen aan NBN S21-203 en DIN 18183, en de voegen afgewerkt met voegband en plamuur.
- Sanitaire toestellen moeten voldoen aan STS 61.02.91 of 61.02.92 en aangesloten worden met afvoerleidingen met reukafsluiter.
- Binnenschilderwerken op pleisterwerk en gipskartonplaten moeten uitgevoerd worden met verf op basis van kunstharsen in dispersie, met minimum 3 stalen ter goedkeuring.
- Houten binnendeurvleugels moeten bekleed worden met hogedruk laminaatplaten volgens NBN EN 438-1, en de langskanten gevernist.
- Er moet een as-built dossier geleverd worden met de uitvoeringsplans, technische fiches, en montageplans.

07.01.10.title: Houten profielen – algemeen (F)

07.01.11.title: Houten profielen – gebeitst (F)

07.01.11.C.summary: No specific execution details found on pages 51-51.

- For kipraam installation, the state of all dakvlakramen (veluxen) must be checked, and a replacement proposal made and submitted to the supervisor. The windows are only removed after approval.
- For wood framing, the wood must be treated according to procedure C1.
- For wood framing, the wood must be dry enough.
- For wood framing, the execution and calculations must comply with STS 31.0 and STS 32.0.
- Steel connecting pieces must be painted with two coats of red lead paint.
